alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 1:51PM EDT until July 05 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cumberland County in central North Carolina... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 151 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Godwin, or 8 miles northeast of Fayetteville, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Godwin, Eastover, Wade, Falcon, Linden and Vander. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
